entities.name: malfoy
entities.description: Malfoy is mentioned as one of the Slytherin students who are reacting negatively to Harry. He is described as whispering something malevolent to Crabbe.

entities.name: crabbe
entities.description: Crabbe is mentioned as one of the Slytherin students who are reacting negatively to Harry.

entities.name: goyle
entities.description: Goyle is mentioned as one of the Slytherin students who are reacting negatively to Harry. He cracked his knuckles threateningly at Harry.

entities.name: theodore nott
entities.description: Theodore Nott is mentioned as a weedy-looking boy who was with Malfoy and Crabbe in the library.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character of the story. He is mentioned as having named all of their fathers as Death Eaters.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as whispering to Harry about Theodore Nott and laughing gleefully when they leave the library.

entities.name: luna
entities.description: Luna is mentioned as telling Harry over dinner that no copy of The Quibbler had ever sold out faster.

entities.name: dad
entities.description: Dad is mentioned as reprinting The Quibbler because people are interested in it more than the Crumple-Horned Snorkacks.

entities.name: death eaters
entities.description: Death Eaters are mentioned as being named by Harry.

entities.name: the quibbler
entities.description: The Quibbler is mentioned as selling out faster than ever before.

entities.name: crumple-horned snorkacks
entities.description: Crumple-Horned Snorkacks are mentioned as being less interesting to people than The Quibbler.

relationships.description: Harry named all of their fathers as Death Eaters.
Dad is reprinting The Quibbler because people are interested in it more than the Crumple-Horned Snorkacks.
Crabbe and Malfoy were reacting negatively to Harry.
Goyle cracked his knuckles threateningly at Harry.
Hermione whispered to Harry about Theodore Nott.
Luna told Harry that no copy of The Quibbler had ever sold out faster.
